title: Anti-Christian arguments
author: VD
content_html:
If Al, Brent and anyone else feels like pitching in, I’d appreciate it if you’d refresh my memory of some of the more common reasons given not to believe in God or Christianity, other than the basic “there is no proof your sky deity doesn’t exist”. I just want to make sure I don’t miss any of the usual ones. I’ve already got these six, what am I missing?

1. A loving God wouldn’t send anyone to Hell.
2. Omnipotence-Omniscience conflict. (I thought knowledge WAS power.)
3. The problem of evil.
4. Euthyphro.
5. I don’t like God / If God exists, I wouldn’t approve of him anyhow.
6. I believe in one less god than you.




I’m sure I’m missing a few, so don’t hesitate to chime in.
content_text:
If Al, Brent and anyone else feels like pitching in, I’d appreciate it if you’d refresh my memory of some of the more common reasons given not to believe in God or Christianity, other than the basic “there is no proof your sky deity doesn’t exist”.  I just want to make sure I don’t miss any of the usual ones.  I’ve already got these six, what am I missing?
1.  A loving God wouldn’t send anyone to Hell.
2.  Omnipotence-Omniscience conflict.  (I thought knowledge WAS power.)
3.  The problem of evil.
4.  Euthyphro.
5.  I don’t like God / If God exists, I wouldn’t approve of him anyhow.
6.  I believe in one less god than you.
I’m sure I’m missing a few, so don’t hesitate to chime in.
